N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.1 - Executive Order No. 1: Relating to the continued validity of executive orders previously issued. [DAGGER]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, It is necessary to have an orderly transition and
administration of State government; and
WHEREAS, Careful scrutiny must be given to existing
executive orders to " ensure their continued effectiveness and desirability; and
WHEREAS, It is the policy of this State to streamline and
simplify the administration of government to ensure efficient
operations; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby designate the Secretary to the Governor, in
conjunction with the Counsel to the Governor, the Director of the Division of
the Budget and the Assistant to the Governor for Management and Productivity, to review and evaluate each existing executive order, taking into consideration
the following: (1)

The continued need
for the executive order and analysis of whether its policy objective can be
accomplished through alternative approaches. (2)

The effectiveness of the executive order
in achieving its objectives, including evaluation of its impact upon the State
and its entities, local governments and the public. (3)

The effectiveness of the entities created
by executive order and evaluation of whether they are accomplishing their
designated mission. (4)

Examination
of the costs of implementation of the executive order. The review required by this Order shall be completed by

January 31, 1983. On or before February 15, 1983, the Secretary to the Governor
shall submit a report to the Governor with recommendations and suggestions for
continuation, modification or revocation of existing executive orders. Every State department, division, board, bureau, commission, council and agency shall provide assistance and cooperate as
necessary for the accomplishment of the purposes of this Order. All executive orders and amendments thereto heretofore
issued and promulgated and in effect as of this date shall remain in full force
and effect until otherwise revoked or modified. No boards, committees, offices, task groups or any similar
entities existing pursuant to executive order shall enter into any financial or
contractual obligations until the review directed by this Order is completed
and final determinations are made as to the continuation, modification or
revocation of the executive orders reviewed. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: January 11, 1983
